item.title: Egyptian Muslim Extremists Repeatedly Stab Coptic Christian to Death, Torch His Car
item.description: A young Coptic Christian man was viciously killed last week in the Egyptian city of Dabaa, Matrouh Governorate. Four unidentified masked men reportedly shot him numerous times while he was at work.

item.title: Pastor Wins Discrimination Case After Losing Job for Warning Parents About Dangers of LGBTQ Events
item.description: An Employment Tribunal in the United Kingdom has determined that a Christian pastor, who also worked as a primary school caretaker, was discriminated against when he was forced out of his part-time job almost three years ago after posting a tweet warning Christians and children against supporting local LGBTQ pride events.

item.title: CBN's Operation Blessing Warehouse in Poland Busy Loading Supplies for Ukrainian Refugees
item.description: Since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began on Feb. 24, refugees have been pouring into European countries like Poland. CBN's Operation Blessing (OB) has been there providing them with food, water, and other essentials.

item.title: Russian State TV Debates Nuking Western Europe, Civilians Escape Mariupol
item.description: Ukrainian civilians are finally being evacuated from the shattered port city of Mariupol, as Russian TV showed a simulated nuclear attack on Western Europe.

item.title: Thousands of Russians Fleeing the War with Ukraine Take Refuge in Armenia
item.description: Thousands of Russians have fled their homeland since the war with Ukraine began and many have taken refuge in Armenia.

item.title: Chinese Communist Party Forces Christian Website to Shut Down After 20 Years of Service
item.description: A long-running Christian website was recently shut down by the Chinese Communist Party as part of the government's ongoing efforts to abolish Christianity.

item.title: COMMENTARY: 'God Is Good, God Is Great' - What Does This Really Mean
item.description: During a pandemic — with job losses, health crises, shortages, and difficulties at every turn — these words mean that people who know God can put their trust in God's greatness because God is great.

item.title: 'Renew Our Minds to the Truth': Passion Founder Louie Giglio Lists 'Secrets' to Reaching Millennials, Gen Z Amid Cultural Chaos
item.description: Pastor Louie Giglio, a prolific pastor and the founder of the Passion movement, has a front-row seat to ministering to America’s young generation.

item.title: 'Life Transformed by Jesus Christ': Thousands Make Professions of Faith During Greg Laurie's 2-Day 'Boise Event'
item.description: The Boise Harvest event at the Extra Mile Arena was jam-packed with prayer and worship last weekend as Pastor Greg Laurie spoke about the purest love and hope that is only found in Jesus Christ.

item.title: CBN's Orphan's Promise Visits Roma Community Where Food Project is Feeding Thousands of Locals and Refugees
item.description: As Ukrainians flee their homes, CBN's Orphan's Promise (OP) is feeding the vulnerable, sharing the Gospel, and working to sustain individuals, families, and communities well into the future.

item.title: Plug Pulled: Fictosexual Man Who Married Computer-Generated Hologram Can No Longer Speak to 'Her'
item.description: After CBN's Faithwire brought you the news this week that a London woman married her cat, there's this little tidbit about a man not being able to communicate with his computer-generated hologram wife.

item.title: Putin Rains Missiles on Kyiv, Russian Forces Slaughter Surrendering Civilians
item.description: Russia is doubling down on its brutal attack, once again raining missiles on the capital city of Kyiv. This time, the strikes came when the U.N. Secretary General was visiting the area. The Kremlin didn't stop there as Russia pounded targets all over Ukraine.

item.title: CBN's Operation Blessing Helps Siblings Fleeing War in Ukraine Find Comfort in Poland
item.description: The brutal fighting in Ukraine has led to a flood of refugees in the last two months. One sister, who takes care of her younger brother, decided they could no longer stay in their home, and they fled to Poland where CBN's Operation Blessing was there to help them.

item.title: Putin Releases American in Prisoner Swap, Turns off Natural Gas for Poland and Bulgaria
item.description: European leaders are blasting Russia's decision to cut natural gas shipments to Poland and Bulgaria as "blackmail."

item.title: How This Orphan's Promise Farm Project Inside Ukraine Is Providing Life-Saving Resources for Refugees
item.description: As Ukrainians flee their homes to get away from the warfare, CBN's Orphan's Promise is providing them with food from a unique farming project.

item.title: Christian Cyclists Raise Over $1 Million for Youth Ministries Around the World
item.description: A Christian cycling group has reached its goal of raising $1 million for global youth ministries.

item.title: 'I Am Her Universe': Woman Marries Her Five-Year-Old Cat
item.description: Deborah Hodge has been forced to give up three pets — two Huskies and one cat — and she is refusing to do it again, according to the New York Post. To circumvent her landlord’s no-pet policy, the British woman has elevated her cat India from pet to spouse.

item.title: Russia Cuts Gas to Poland, Bulgaria, West Vows Arms For Kyiv
item.description: The U.S. defense chief urged Ukraine's allies to “move at the speed of war” to get more and heavier weapons to Kyiv as Russian forces rained fire on eastern and southern Ukraine, and Russia cut off gas supplies to Poland and Bulgaria.

item.title: Russian Troops Burn Stockpiles of Bibles as Mission Eurasia Ministry Center Destroyed by Tanks in Ukraine
item.description: Mission Eurasia, a nonprofit ministry that is helping meet the needs of Ukrainian refugees fleeing the war, reports that one of its training centers in Irpin was destroyed by tanks during a battle between Russian and Ukrainian forces last month.

item.title: Aspiring Teen Athletes Among Passengers Who Narrowly Escaped Death in Philippines Bus Bombing
item.description: At least four people were hurt when an improvised explosive device (IED) detonated inside a bus in Maguindanao, Southern Philippines, on Sunday.

item.title: Religious Freedom Report Shows 'Few Bright Spots', Afghanistan Returns to Blacklist in Wake of US Pullout
item.description: The U.S. Commission on International Religious Freedom wants the State Department to add Afghanistan to the list of worst religious freedom violators.
